tool.name: LogisticRegressionTool

param.name: Evidence_Type
param.dialogReference:
The evidence type determines how the evidence is used in the logistic regression and how many coefficients are determined. If the type is ordered, then only one coefficient will be determined for the evidence. If the type is free, which means categorical evidence, then a coefficient will be determined for each Gen_class in the free evidence.

Acceptable values are 'ordered' and 'free'.

Ordered can be entered more simply as an O or o.

Categorical can be entered more simply as f, F, C, or c.

param.name: Missing_Data_Value
param.dialogReference:
Default missing data value is -99. If this value is not appropriate because it conflicts with valid evidence values, the user can select another negative value.

The Missing Data value is required to be a negative integer smaller than the other valid values in the evidence raster.

param.name: Unit_Area_sq_km
param.dialogReference: The Unit Area should be the same value used in previous tools used for this model. See the Help file in Calculate Weights for more information on Unit Area. If this tool is being applied to a Fuzzy Logic or Neural Net model enter a value of 1.

param.name: Output_Polynomial_Table
param.dialogReference: Catalog path of output polynomial dbase table.

param.name: Output_Coefficients_Table
param.dialogReference: Catalog path of output coefficients dbase table.

param.name: Output_Standard_Deviation_raster
param.dialogReference: Catalog path of output standard deviation raster.

tool.summary: This tool is a useful complement to Weights-of-Evidence Calculate Response tool as Logistic Regression does not make the assumption of conditional independence of the evidence with regards to the training sites. Using the evidence and assocaited weights tables, this tool creates the outputs the response and standard deviation rasters. The calculations are based on the Gen_Class attribute in the weights table and the type of evidence.
